Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of North Ionian pottery lotus bowl; interior: glazed with thin reserved band below rim; exterior: pendent lotus flower and a large dot on its left side, one thin line and two thick glazed bands below the handle zone. Something touching the interior surface in the kiln has caused an unusual firing effect.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.581)
